intro: Tribulus macropterus var. brevistylus, commonly known as the short-styled tribulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Zygophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and spiny stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, with small, narrow lobes. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
